data.title: Academic Overview
data.content: GIKI offers a comprehensive range of undergraduate and graduate programs across various engineering and science disciplines, focusing on innovation, critical thinking, and research.

data.title: Faculty of Engineering Sciences
data.content: The Faculty of Engineering Sciences blends Mathematics, Physics, Computing, and Engineering in its programs. It prepares students for real-world problem-solving and technological innovation.

data.title: Faculty of Computer Science and Engineering
data.content: Programs offered include Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, and Cyber Security. The faculty aims to produce graduates with a solid foundation in computing and technical expertise.

data.title: Faculty of Mechanical Engineering
data.content: This faculty provides in-depth education in mechanical design, thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, and manufacturing, fostering students' ability to innovate and apply their knowledge effectively.

data.title: Faculty of Materials and Chemical Engineering
data.content: Programs here cover the development and application of advanced materials and chemical processes, emphasizing sustainable solutions and industry applications.

data.title: Faculty of Civil Engineering
data.content: The BS Civil Engineering program focuses on structural engineering, construction technology, materials science, and sustainable infrastructure development.

data.title: Faculty of Management Sciences and Humanities
data.content: The faculty offers a BS in Management Sciences program that combines management theories with technical skills to equip students for leadership roles in various industries.

data.title: Library
data.content: The library supports academic and research activities with a comprehensive collection of books, scholarly journals, e-books, and digital resources for students and faculty.

data.title: Research and Development
data.content: GIKI promotes active research initiatives across faculties, collaborating with industry and international universities to advance technological knowledge and innovation.

data.title: State-of-the-Art Labs
data.content: GIKI is equipped with modern laboratories that provide hands-on experience to students in various engineering disciplines, enhancing practical knowledge and skill development.

data.title: Student Support Services
data.content: GIKI offers robust student support services, including academic advising, career counseling, and mentoring programs to assist students throughout their academic journey.

data.title: Academic Calendar
data.content: The academic year includes two regular semesters and an optional summer session. The detailed academic calendar outlines key dates for the academic community.

data.title: Grading and Examination Policies
data.content: GIKI maintains strict academic standards with clearly defined grading and examination policies to ensure academic integrity and fairness in student evaluations.

data.title: MS and PhD Programs
data.content: Graduate programs are offered in various engineering and science disciplines, focusing on research, development, and contributing to cutting-edge advancements.

data.title: International Partnerships
data.content: GIKI has formed collaborations with international universities and research centers to provide exchange opportunities and joint research projects, enhancing the global exposure of its students.

data.title: Semester Structure
data.content: The academic year at GIKI comprises two regular semesters of sixteen weeks each, and an eight-week summer school. The duration of two regular semesters and summer school is as follows: Fall: August to December; Spring: January to May; Summer: June to July. The last week of a semester is allocated to final examinations.

data.title: Credit Hour Definition
data.content: A credit hour is defined as one lecture of 50 minutes per week over a 16-week semester. For laboratory courses, three lab hours constitute one credit hour.

data.title: Semester Course Load
data.content: The normal course load for undergraduate students is 15-18 credit hours per semester. Students may take additional credits with prior approval from the academic advisor.

data.title: Grading Scale
data.content: GIKI follows a letter grading system with corresponding grade points: A (4.0), A- (3.7), B+ (3.3), B (3.0), B- (2.7), C+ (2.3), C (2.0), C- (1.7), D+ (1.3), D (1.0), F (0.0).

data.title: Class Attendance Requirements
data.content: Students are required to maintain a minimum of 75% attendance in each course to be eligible for final examinations.

data.title: Assessment Methods
data.content: Assessment includes quizzes, assignments, mid-term exams, and final exams. The weightage of each component varies by course and is communicated at the beginning of the semester.

data.title: GPA Requirements
data.content: Students must maintain a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.0 to remain in good academic standing. Falling below this may result in academic probation.

data.title: Graduation Criteria
data.content: To graduate, students must complete the prescribed credit hours, maintain the required GPA, and fulfill all departmental requirements.

data.title: Overview
data.content: The academic year at GIKI comprises two regular semesters of sixteen weeks each and an eight-week summer school. The schedule is as follows: Fall Semester: August to December; Spring Semester: January to May; Summer School: June to July. The last week of each semester is allocated for final examinations.

data.title: Central Library
data.content: The Central Library at Ghulam Ishaq Khan Institute (GIKI) is a three-story building established in 1996, offering a vast collection of books, eBooks, journals, and audiovisual materials. It provides an intellectual sanctuary for students and faculty, fostering a conducive environment for study and research.

data.title: Library Amenities
data.content: The library is fully air-conditioned and offers a Wi-Fi facility for internet access. It includes a furnished seminar room and provides 18 hours of access daily, extending to round-the-clock availability during examinations.

data.title: Electronic Databases and Catalogs
data.content: GIKI's library provides desktop access to various e-databases, eBooks, and library catalogs to all campus readers. It is electronically linked with prominent institutions of science and technology in the country to facilitate resource sharing through inter-library loans and database information exchange.

data.title: Library Search System
data.content: The Online Public Access Catalog (OPAC) allows users to search for books and other materials available in the GIKI library from their desktops. It includes a rich collection of books on subjects like electronics, computer science, materials science, mechanical engineering, engineering sciences, management sciences, social sciences, Islamic literature, Urdu and English literature, and reference books such as dictionaries and encyclopedias.

data.title: Digital Book Collection
data.content: GIKI's E-Library offers a rich collection of e-books accessible within the campus. These books cover a variety of subjects, including computer hardware and software engineering, engineering sciences, mechanical engineering, electronic engineering, and humanities/management sciences.

data.title: Online Journals and Databases
data.content: The Digital Library provides access to a vast collection of industry-leading standards and technical engineering information, covering a broad range of engineering disciplines, including aerospace, biomedical, chemical, civil, environmental, geological, health and safety, industrial, materials science, mechanical, and nuclear engineering.

data.title: Online Access
data.content: The GIKI Institute Library maintains its own portal where users can find the latest information about library collections, digital library access, and more.

data.title: Library Staff
data.content: Assistant Librarian: Mr. Muhammad Riaz (mriaz@giki.edu.pk, Ext: 2457); Library Assistant: Mr. Hamid Iqbal (hamidiqbal@giki.edu.pk, Ext: 2644); Library Assistant: Mr. Lal Bahadar (lalbahadar@giki.edu.pk, Ext: 2645); Library Assistant: Mr. Nisar Ali (Nisar.ali@giki.edu.pk, Ext: 2645).

data.title: Overview
data.content: The Student Affairs Office at GIKI serves as a liaison between students, faculty, and administration, aiming to enhance the quality of student life both inside and outside the classroom. It leads, directs, and administers functions such as student counseling, hostel residence, student societies, and discipline.

data.title: Student Counseling
data.content: The Student Affairs Office provides counseling services to assist students with academic, personal, or emotional challenges. A full-time Assistant Director of Student Affairs is readily available to help students address any problems they encounter on campus.

data.title: Hostel Residence
data.content: The office manages hostel accommodations, ensuring a comfortable and conducive living environment for students. It oversees the allocation of rooms, maintenance of facilities, and addresses any residential concerns.

data.title: Student Societies
data.content: GIKI hosts a variety of student societies that cater to diverse interests, including technical, cultural, and recreational activities. The Student Affairs Office supports these societies in organizing events, workshops, and seminars to enrich the campus experience.

data.title: Student Discipline
data.content: The office is responsible for upholding the institute's code of conduct, addressing disciplinary issues, and ensuring a respectful and safe environment for all students.

data.title: Health Services
data.content: GIKI provides health services to promote the well-being of students, including access to medical facilities and health awareness programs.

data.title: Career Counseling
data.content: The Student Affairs Office offers career counseling services to guide students in their professional development, including resume building, interview preparation, and job placement assistance.

data.title: Campus Events
data.content: The office coordinates various campus events, including cultural festivals, sports competitions, and academic seminars, fostering a vibrant campus life.

data.title: Alumni Engagement
data.content: Maintaining strong connections with alumni, the Student Affairs Office organizes reunions and networking events to build a supportive community for current students.

data.title: Support Services
data.content: The office provides various support services, including academic advising, mentorship programs, and assistance for students with disabilities, ensuring an inclusive environment.

data.title: Admissions and Examinations Office
data.content: The Office of Admissions and Examinations at GIKI oversees the entire admissions process, from application to enrollment, and manages examination procedures, ensuring academic integrity and compliance with institutional policies.

data.title: Application Procedures
data.content: Prospective students can apply online through the admissions portal, providing necessary academic records and personal information. The office evaluates applications based on eligibility criteria and academic performance.

data.title: Scheduling and Coordination
data.content: The office is responsible for preparing semester timetables, date sheets, and coordinating the conduct of semester examinations, including midterms and finals.

data.title: Grade Processing
data.content: Post-examination, the office compiles and processes results, ensuring accuracy before releasing them to students. It also handles the issuance of transcripts and result cards.

data.title: Certification
data.content: Upon successful completion of programs, the office issues degrees and language proficiency certificates to graduates, maintaining records for verification purposes.

data.title: Grade Review Process
data.content: Students dissatisfied with their grades can apply for rechecking or re-totaling of their final exam papers by submitting a prescribed form and paying the requisite fee.

data.title: Key Personnel
data.content: The office comprises dedicated staff, including the Director of Admissions and Examinations, Deputy Director of Examinations, Assistant Director of Admissions and Examinations, Admission Officer, Examination Officer, and Office Assistants.

data.title: Office Contacts
data.content: For inquiries, contact the office via email at faheem@giki.edu.pk or phone at (0938) 281026, extensions 2205, 2425, 2345, 2518, 2425, 2349, 2301, and 2342.

data.title: Regulations and Guidelines
data.content: The office ensures adherence to academic policies, including examination conduct, grading systems, and academic integrity standards.

data.title: Assistance Services
data.content: The office provides support services to students regarding admissions, examinations, and academic records, facilitating a smooth academic journey.

data.title: Overview
data.content: The Quality Enhancement Cell (QEC) at Ghulam Ishaq Khan Institute of Engineering Sciences and Technology (GIKI) was established on February 20, 2008, within the Rector's Secretariat in the H.U. Beg Administration Building. Following the Higher Education Commission (HEC) guidelines, the QEC is integral to advancing and maintaining educational quality. Its primary function is to develop, implement, and monitor quality assurance policies that align with national and international standards.

data.title: Core Responsibilities
data.content: The QEC is responsible for conducting internal evaluations of academic programs and faculty performance to ensure compliance with accreditation requirements and institutional goals. It systematically reviews curricula and teaching methodologies to reflect current industry standards and educational trends. Additionally, the QEC gathers and analyzes feedback from students, faculty, and other stakeholders to identify areas for improvement and implement action plans accordingly. It plays a crucial role in facilitating external audits and ensuring continuous alignment with HEC directives. The QEC also promotes faculty development through training workshops and fosters communication between all stakeholders to support quality enhancement initiatives across the institution.

data.title: Continuous Improvement Process
data.content: The self-assessment program review process at GIKI is a critical component of its commitment to maintaining high educational standards and fostering continuous improvement. This process involves a comprehensive internal evaluation where faculty, staff, and stakeholders collaboratively assess the effectiveness of academic programs against predefined criteria. Through detailed analyses of curriculum content, teaching methodologies, student outcomes, and resource utilization, the self-assessment aims to identify strengths, areas for improvement, and potential innovations. The findings from these reviews guide strategic planning and decision-making, ensuring that the Institute’s programs remain aligned with industry standards and evolving educational trends, ultimately enhancing the quality of education and student experience.

data.title: Evaluating Academic Programs
data.content: The Self-Assessment Review Process, as outlined by the Quality Assurance Agency (QAA) of the Higher Education Commission (HEC), serves as a critical mechanism for ensuring the excellence and accountability of higher education institutions. This process is designed to facilitate a thorough and reflective evaluation of academic programs and institutional practices, promoting continuous improvement and adherence to established quality standards. By engaging in a comprehensive self-assessment, institutions can identify strengths, address areas for development, and enhance their overall educational offerings. This review supports the institution’s commitment to delivering high-quality education and reinforces its dedication to maintaining transparency and responsiveness in a dynamic academic landscape.

data.title: Faculty Development Initiatives
data.content: The QEC organizes various training sessions and seminars to promote quality awareness and enhance faculty development. Notable events include workshops on Continuous Professional Development Programs, Quality Awareness Seminars, and international workshops on Outcome-Based Education (OBE). These initiatives aim to equip faculty members with the necessary skills and knowledge to maintain and improve educational quality.

data.title: Global Academic Standing
data.content: GIKI actively participates in international rankings, demonstrating its commitment to achieving and showcasing global academic excellence. By engaging with various renowned ranking systems, the Institute highlights its strengths in research, teaching quality, and overall institutional performance on an international platform. This participation provides valuable insights into its comparative standing among leading global institutions and drives continuous improvement and strategic enhancements. The recognition gained through these rankings underscores GIKI’s dedication to maintaining high standards and its role as a significant contributor to the global higher education landscape.

data.title: Stakeholder Feedback Mechanisms
data.content: The QEC conducts various surveys to gather feedback from different stakeholders, including students, alumni, and employers. These surveys are conducted online, with appropriate time given to participants to provide their responses. Regular reminders are issued to improve response rates, and most surveys are anonymous to protect respondent identities. Upon closure, survey reports are prepared, containing necessary details such as survey statistics, results, and comments. These reports are reviewed by the highest-level management to gain insights into stakeholders' perceptions and address any issues, facilitating timely and necessary changes within the institute.

data.title: Office of Research, Innovation, and Commercialization (ORIC)
data.content: The Office of Research, Innovation, and Commercialization (ORIC) at Ghulam Ishaq Khan Institute of Engineering Sciences and Technology (GIKI) serves as a pivotal entity in fostering research excellence, innovation, and industry collaboration. Established to bridge the gap between academia and industry, ORIC aims to enhance the quality and impact of research activities, promote commercialization of research outcomes, and strengthen relationships with industrial partners.

data.title: Strategic Objectives
data.content: ORIC envisions positioning GIKI as a leading institution in research and innovation, contributing significantly to technological advancements and societal development. Its mission encompasses facilitating high-quality research, encouraging innovation and entrepreneurship, and ensuring the effective commercialization of research outputs.

data.title: Support for Research Activities
data.content: ORIC provides comprehensive support to faculty and students in initiating and conducting research projects. This includes assistance in proposal development, securing funding, and managing research grants. The office ensures adherence to ethical standards and compliance with institutional and regulatory guidelines throughout the research process.

data.title: Promoting Startups and Spin-offs
data.content: To cultivate an entrepreneurial culture, ORIC offers resources and mentorship to students and faculty interested in transforming innovative ideas into viable startups. The office organizes workshops, seminars, and training sessions on entrepreneurship, intellectual property rights, and business development.

data.title: Partnerships and Linkages
data.content: ORIC actively seeks to establish and strengthen partnerships with industry stakeholders. These collaborations facilitate joint research projects, internships, and employment opportunities for students, and ensure that academic programs align with industry needs. Notably, ORIC organized an event where Atlas Honda gifted their latest electric vehicle bike, the Honda BENLY e:, to GIKI, marking a significant step in joint research and innovation in Pakistan's electric mobility sector.

data.title: Technology Transfer and Licensing
data.content: ORIC oversees the commercialization of research outputs by facilitating technology transfer and licensing agreements. The office assists in identifying marketable research, protecting intellectual property, and negotiating with potential commercial partners to bring innovations to market.

data.title: Student Placement and Development
data.content: The Career Services Office, operating under ORIC, plays a vital role in connecting students, graduates, and alumni with leading employers. It offers career counseling, organizes job fairs, and maintains ties with industry to facilitate internships and job placements. The office is dedicated to the success of students and alumni in their professional endeavors.

data.title: Engagement and Networking
data.content: ORIC is committed to fostering enduring relationships with GIKI alumni. It organizes events, reunions, and networking opportunities to strengthen connections between the institute and its graduates, encouraging their involvement in academic and research activities.

data.title: Showcasing Talent and Research
data.content: To establish liaison between the institute and industry, ORIC organizes the annual Industrial Open House and Careers Fair. This event provides a platform for students to showcase their projects and for industries to explore potential collaborations and recruit talent.

data.title: Reach Out to ORIC
data.content: Office of Research, Innovation, and Commercialization (ORIC), G-17, Admin Block, GIK Institute of Engineering Sciences & Technology, Topi, District Swabi, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Tel: +92-938-271858 Ext. 2289, 2530. Email: oric@giki.edu.pk.

data.title: Tuition and Accommodation Fees
data.content: For the academic year 2024-25, the semester fee for Engineering programs is PKR 427,500, totaling PKR 855,000 annually. For Management Sciences, the semester fee is PKR 375,000, totaling PKR 750,000 annually. These fees cover tuition and accommodation charges. A 5% administrative charge applies per semester unless the entire annual fee is paid in a lump sum. The semester fee is non-refundable, except in cases where an applicant becomes ineligible upon result declaration, in which case a refund is provided.

data.title: Tuition Fees and Additional Charges
data.content: The annual tuition fee for graduate programs is subject to periodic revisions. A non-refundable admission fee of PKR 65,000 is required at the time of admission. Additionally, a refundable security deposit of PKR 30,000 is charged, which is refundable upon clearance from relevant departments upon leaving the institute. Final-year students are charged a convocation fee of PKR 17,500. An advance of PKR 8,000 is to be deposited by each student as mess security, with actual charges deducted monthly.

data.title: Fee Submission Channels
data.content: Students can pay their semester or annual fees through various channels: over the counter at any branch of Habib Bank Limited (HBL), HBL Internet Banking or Mobile App (HBL network only), and 1-Bill Top-up for all banks. Detailed procedures for each payment method are provided on the institute's website.

data.title: Tuition Fee Refund Guidelines
data.content: If a newly admitted student withdraws their admission, the following refund policy applies: 100% refund before joining the institute; 100% refund minus 10% administrative charges within the first seven days of class commencement; 50% refund from the 8th to the 15th day after classes begin; no refund from the 16th day onward. In cases where an applicant becomes ineligible upon result declaration, a 100% tuition fee refund is provided if applied for within 10 days of result declaration, along with proof of ineligibility.

data.title: Tax Deduction on Fees
data.content: A withholding tax under section 236I of the Income Tax Ordinance 2001 is applicable at a rate of 5% on tuition fees, admission fees, and administrative charges.

data.title: Miscellaneous Fees
data.content: Final-year students are charged a convocation fee of PKR 17,000. An advance of PKR 15,000 is to be deposited by each student as mess security, with actual charges deducted monthly. A refundable security deposit of PKR 30,000 is also required at the time of admission, subject to clearance from relevant departments upon leaving the institute.

data.title: Tuition Fees for International Students
data.content: The annual tuition fee for foreign students is USD 3,000. Additional charges, including administrative fees and security deposits, apply as per the institute's policies.

data.section: Bench Fee for Overstaying Graduate Students
data.title: Charges for Extended Study Periods
data.content: Graduate students availing GIK Institute scholarships are allowed a normal duration without additional charges and stipend. For MS students, the normal duration is 2 years with a 6-month grace period; for PhD students, it is 3 years with a 1-year grace period. Beyond the grace period, a bench fee of PKR 100,000 per semester is charged, up to the maximum duration of 2 years for MS and 2 years for PhD students. Beyond this, students must pay the full fee.

data.title: Electricity Allowance for Hostel Residents
data.content: The institute provides free electricity units to hostel residents: 93 units per month for male students and 100 units per month for female students during summer; 70 units per month for both male and female students during winter. Additional free units are allocated for common areas per hostel. Any excess consumption is charged to the students.

data.title: Faculty of Electrical Engineering
data.content: The Faculty of Electrical Engineering (FEE) at Ghulam Ishaq Khan Institute of Engineering Sciences and Technology (GIKI) is dedicated to delivering comprehensive and state-of-the-art electrical engineering education. Aligning with national requirements and international best practices, FEE aims to enhance student learning and prepare graduates for the evolving technological landscape.

data.title: Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering
data.content: FEE offers a four-year Bachelor of Science (BS) degree in Electrical Engineering with specializations in Electronic Engineering and Power Engineering. The curriculum is designed to equip students with the knowledge and skills necessary to lead future engineering teams and realize innovative ideas.

data.title: Master of Science and Doctor of Philosophy in Electrical Engineering
data.content: FEE provides graduate programs leading to Master of Science (MS) and Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) degrees in Electrical Engineering. Specializations include Microelectronics, MEMS and ASIC Design; Power and Control Systems; and Communication and Digital Signal Processing.

data.title: Focused Research Domains
data.content: FEE emphasizes research in key areas such as Communication and Digital Signal Processing, Microelectronics and ASIC Design, and Electric Power and Control Systems. These thrust areas align with industry needs and technological advancements.

data.title: State-of-the-Art Labs
data.content: FEE houses advanced laboratories, including the Microwave Laboratory, Microelectronics Laboratory, Electric Machines Laboratory, Signals & Image Processing Laboratory, and Telecommunications Laboratory. These facilities provide students with hands-on experience to understand and apply electrical engineering concepts.

data.title: Experienced Academic Staff
data.content: FEE boasts a team of qualified faculty members with diverse research interests. Notable faculty include Dr. Hadeed Ahmed Sher, specializing in photovoltaic applications and power electronics; Dr. Waleed Tariq Sethi, focusing on 5G and 6G sub-THz communication and applied electromagnetics; and Dr. Zia ul Haq Abbas, with expertise in stochastic processes and performance analysis of computer and communication networks.

data.title: Comprehensive Curriculum
data.content: FEE offers a wide range of courses covering fundamental and advanced topics in electrical engineering. Courses include Linear Circuit Analysis, Electronic Devices & Circuits, Communication Systems, Digital Signal Processing, and Antenna Theory & Design.

data.title: Quality Assurance
data.content: The undergraduate programs in Electrical Engineering at GIKI are accredited by the Pakistan Engineering Council (PEC), ensuring adherence to national educational standards and quality benchmarks.

data.title: Get in Touch
data.content: For more information about the Faculty of Electrical Engineering, its programs, requirements, scholarships, and career options, please contact the faculty office via email at fee@giki.edu.pk or phone at +92-938-271858.

data.title: Faculty of Computer Science and Engineering (FCSE)
data.content: The Faculty of Computer Science and Engineering (FCSE) at Ghulam Ishaq Khan Institute of Engineering Sciences and Technology (GIKI) is dedicated to nurturing skilled scientists and engineers who demonstrate excellence in both practical applications and research within the field of computing. The faculty leverages cutting-edge technologies to enrich learning experiences and provides a dynamic environment conducive to student growth.

data.title: Bachelor of Science Degrees
data.content:
FCSE offers a range of Bachelor of Science (BS) programs designed to equip students with the requisite skills and knowledge essential for thriving in today’s rapidly evolving technology landscape. The programs include:

- **BS in Computer Engineering**: Focuses on a blend of computer science and electrical engineering topics, preparing students for various career opportunities in the computing industry.
- **BS in Computer Science**: Provides a broad understanding of the field through intensive education in core areas such as databases, graphics, software engineering, and computer systems development.
- **BS in Artificial Intelligence**: Partnered with Huawei, this program aims to impart in-depth knowledge required to transform data into intelligent decisions, focusing on machine-based decision-making from complex inputs.
- **BS in Cyber Security**: Covers core computing and cybersecurity courses, industrial labs, internships, and social sciences to prepare graduates for the future economy.
- **BS in Data Science**: Combines mathematical, statistical, and computing principles with electives in various areas of computer science to develop a professional approach to designing computer-based systems.
- **BS in Software Engineering**: Emphasizes software and systems engineering, software project management, and software requirements engineering.

data.title: Master and Doctoral Degrees
data.content: FCSE offers Master of Science (MS) and Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) degrees in both Computer Science and Computer Engineering. These programs are meticulously designed to equip students with advanced knowledge and research skills, addressing the evolving needs of industry, academia, and society.

data.title: Focused Research Domains
data.content:
FCSE emphasizes research in key areas to address the evolving needs of industry, academia, and society. The thrust areas include:

- Artificial Intelligence and Robotics
- Algorithms and Computational Theory
- High Performance Computing
- Machine Learning & Data Mining
- Network Communications and Distributed Systems
- Signal and Image Processing
- Software and Systems Engineering
- Software Project Management
- Software Requirements Engineering
- UI/UX Design
- Data Science & Data Mining
- Data Warehousing
- Data Visualization
- Big Data Analytics
- Cyber Security
- Penetration Testing
- Cryptography

data.title: Experienced Academic Staff
data.content:
FCSE boasts a team of qualified faculty members with diverse research interests. Notable faculty include:

- **Prof. Dr. Qadeer Ul Hasan**: Dean of FCSE, with research interests in Machine Learning, Energy Management Systems, Adaptive Signal Processing, and Cognitive Radio.
- **Prof. Dr. Zahid Halim**: Dean of Open Distance Learning, specializing in Data Science, Machine Learning and Data Mining, Intelligent Transportation Systems, and Computational Intelligence.
- **Prof. Dr. Ghulam Abbas**: Head of Software Engineering & Cyber Security, focusing on computer networks, wireless communications, and distributed systems.
- **Prof. Dr. Masroor Hussain**: Head of Computer Engineering & Data Science, with expertise in High Performance Computing, Computational Science, Data Mining, Neural Networks, Image Processing, and Video Mining.

data.title: State-of-the-Art Labs
data.content:
FCSE is well-equipped with state-of-the-art computer systems running a wide range of applications and specialized software supporting the courses. The faculty provides well-equipped research laboratories for the use of faculty, graduate students, and senior undergraduate students. Notable facilities include:

- **Programming and Computing (PC) Lab**: The central computing laboratory of the Institute, providing general-purpose computing facilities to all students, as well as internet and printing facilities.

data.title: Quality Assurance
data.content: The undergraduate programs in Computer Engineering at GIKI are accredited by the Pakistan Engineering Council (PEC) under level-II, i.e., Outcome-Based Education (OBE). Other programs are accredited by the National Computing Education Accreditation Council (NCEAC), ensuring adherence to national educational standards and quality benchmarks.

data.title: Employment Prospects
data.content: Graduates of FCSE have secured employment in renowned national and international organizations, including Microsoft, Google, IBM, and Amazon, among others. The comprehensive programs equip students with the requisite skills and knowledge essential for thriving in today’s rapidly evolving technology landscape.

data.title: Get in Touch
data.content: For more information about the Faculty of Computer Science and Engineering, its programs, requirements, scholarships, and career options, please contact the faculty office via email at fcse@giki.edu.pk or phone at +92-938-271858.

data.title: Faculty of Engineering Sciences (FES)
data.content: The Faculty of Engineering Sciences (FES) at Ghulam Ishaq Khan Institute of Engineering Sciences and Technology (GIKI) offers a unique interdisciplinary program that integrates various engineering disciplines with applied physics and mathematics. Established to produce future-ready engineers, FES emphasizes flexibility and adaptability in its curriculum, preparing graduates to excel in diverse industrial, research, business, and academic ventures.

data.title: Bachelor of Science in Engineering Sciences
data.content:
FES offers a four-year Bachelor of Science (BS) degree in Engineering Sciences. The program is accredited by the Pakistan Engineering Council (PEC) under the Washington Accord Level-II category of Outcome-Based Education (OBE) system. Students are required to complete 19 credit hours in one of the following specialization fields:

- **Photonics and Semiconductor Devices**
- **Applied Mathematics and Computational Science**
- **Energy Systems Engineering**

The curriculum includes advanced elective courses and projects tailored to develop expertise in the chosen specialization.

data.title: Master of Science and Doctor of Philosophy in Engineering Sciences
data.content: FES offers graduate programs leading to Master of Science (MS) and Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) degrees in Engineering Sciences. These programs focus on emerging fields of engineering science and technology, aiming to produce effective practicing engineers and researchers. The graduate curriculum is designed to meet the industrial needs of the new millennium, emphasizing research and development in various engineering sciences and technology domains.

data.title: Focused Research Domains
data.content:
FES emphasizes research in key areas to address the evolving needs of industry, academia, and society. The thrust areas include:

- **Photonics and Semiconductor Devices**: Research in lasers, electro-optics, and semiconductor devices.

data.title: About GIK Institute
data.content: GIKI is a premier institution in Pakistan known for engineering, sciences, and technology, focusing on excellence and innovation.

data.title: Genesis and Vision
data.content: Established in 1993 with the vision of Mr. Ghulam Ishaq Khan, aiming to reduce dependency on foreign expertise through local talent cultivation.

data.title: Programs Offered
data.content: Comprehensive programs in engineering, computer sciences, and management are provided, coupled with state-of-the-art labs.

data.title: Campus and Extracurriculars
data.content: GIKI offers a vibrant campus life with over 24 active student societies, promoting leadership and holistic development.

data.title: Recognition
data.content: GIKI is accredited by the HEC and PEC, receiving national and international acclaim for educational quality.

data.title: Board of Governors
data.content: The Board of Governors is the highest authority at GIKI, overseeing the institute's strategic direction and ensuring adherence to its mission and vision.

data.title: President of the Board
data.content: Engr. Salim Saifullah Khan serves as the President of the Board of Governors, bringing extensive experience and leadership to the institute.

data.title: Founding Members of the Board
data.content: The founding members include Engr. Salim Saifullah Khan, Mr. M. Adil Khattak, Mr. Iftikhar H. Shirazi, Mr. Kh. Zaheer Ahmad, and Mr. Osman Saifullah Khan.

data.title: Board Members
data.content: The Board comprises distinguished individuals such as Mr. Tariq Iqbal Khan, Dr. Muhammad Zubair Khan, Dr. Samia Altaf, Mr. Shah Faisal Afridi, Ms. Khadija Jamal Shahban, and Ms. Nargis Ali Akbar Ghaloo.

data.title: Executive Director SOPREST
data.content: Mr. Shakil Durrani, a Pakistan Administrative Service officer, serves as the Executive Director of SOPREST, contributing his vast administrative experience.

data.title: Ex-officio Members of the Board
data.content: The Board includes ex-officio members such as the Chairman of the Higher Education Commission, Chairman of WAPDA, Executive Director of SOPREST, Secretary of Finance Division, Chief Secretary of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Secretary of Science and Information Technology of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Director General of National Information Technology Board, Rector of GIK Institute, Pro-Rector (A&F) of GIK Institute, and Pro-Rector (A) of GIK Institute.

data.title: Acting Secretary of the Board
data.content: Mr. Irfan Ahmad serves as the Acting Secretary of the Board of Governors, facilitating communication and coordination among board members.

data.title: President's Message
data.content: The President of GIKI expresses satisfaction with the institute's strides in education and research, highlighting its leading position in engineering fields and expansion into innovative areas. Emphasis is placed on the institute's commitment to excellence in the digital age, with plans for an Artificial Intelligence center and partnerships with foreign universities and corporations.

data.title: Commitment to Quality Education
data.content: GIKI maintains its leading position in various engineering disciplines and has expanded its activities to provide quality education in new and innovative areas at the cutting edge of technological research, innovation, and development worldwide.

data.title: Artificial Intelligence Center
data.content: Plans for setting up a Center for work on Artificial Intelligence (AI) and its applications to National Development are under active consideration. GIKI has forged important partnerships for faculty and student exchange with a number of well-known foreign universities and a well-known international corporation.

data.title: Business and Management Program
data.content: The Business and Management program offers opportunities to students to couple their technical knowledge and skills with the practical know-how of entrepreneurship and enterprise development.

data.title: Merit-Based Enrollment
data.content: GIKI has always striven to select the best and the most motivated students. Selection on merit has always been the only criterion for enrollment.

data.title: Increase in Female Enrollment
data.content: There has been a significant increase in the number of female students excelling in every field, with hopes for larger female enrollment in the future.

data.title: Dedicated Leadership
data.content: The capable management, under the leadership of the Rector and supported by distinguished faculty members, is recognized as a body of competent and dedicated supervisors, teachers, and support staff, and an asset to the institution.

data.title: Supportive Environment
data.content: The expanding GIKI facilities, with spacious grounds, elegant classrooms and hostels, state-of-the-art equipment and laboratories, offer a fully supportive environment for study, research, creative activities, and sports.

data.title: Rector's Message
data.content: The Rector emphasizes GIKI's reputation built on the quality of its faculty, students, and facilities, particularly laboratories. Faculty members with outstanding academic credentials have been publishing research in high-repute journals, often collaborating with international universities.

data.title: Faculty Achievements
data.content: Faculty members have won numerous awards, including 'Outstanding Research' and 'Best Research Paper' by the Higher Education Commission (HEC) of Pakistan. A record number of research projects were funded by external agencies.

data.title: Times Higher Education Ranking
data.content: GIKI was ranked by Times Higher Education (THE) at Number 24 in the world (and Number one in Pakistan) for 'Quality Education' in its University Impact Rankings related to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals.

data.title: Program and Enrollment Growth
data.content: Starting with just 120 students in 1993, GIKI now has over 2,000 students. Initially offering five disciplines without a graduate program, it now offers 11 disciplines, with the graduate program introduced in 2001 and over 200 students enrolled.

data.title: Community Contributions
data.content: The growth has been possible due to the strong support of alumni, Board of Governors members, and other friends and well-wishers.

data.title: BS in Artificial Intelligence
data.content: From Fall 2020, GIKI introduced a BS in Artificial Intelligence program with the support of Huawei. This 'BS in AI – Partnered by Huawei' program is unique outside of China, reflecting GIKI's stature.

data.title: Overview
data.content: The Ghulam Ishaq Khan Institute of Engineering Sciences and Technology (GIKI) offers a comprehensive undergraduate admissions process for prospective students aiming to pursue Bachelor of Science (BS) degrees in various engineering and management disciplines. The institute emphasizes a merit-based selection system, ensuring equal opportunities for all applicants. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}

data.title: Undergraduate Degree Programs
data.content:
GIKI provides the following BS programs:

- **Engineering Programs**:
  - Mechanical Engineering
  - Electrical Engineering
  - Computer Engineering
  - Chemical Engineering
  - Materials Engineering
  - Civil Engineering
  - Software Engineering
  - Artificial Intelligence
  - Cyber Security
  - Data Science
- **Management Sciences**:
  - BS in Management Sciences

data.title: Basic Eligibility Requirements
data.content:
Candidates must meet one of the following criteria:

- **Engineering Programs**:
  - HSSC (Pre-Engineering) with at least 60% marks in Mathematics, Physics, and overall.
  - HSSC (ICS) with at least 60% marks in Mathematics, Physics, and overall.
  - A-Level with D or above grades in Mathematics, Physics, and Chemistry.
  - American or Canadian High School Diploma with Mathematics (with Calculus), Physics, and Chemistry, achieving 60% or above marks as per IBCC equivalence formula.
  - Three-year Diploma of Associate Engineering (DAE) in a relevant technology with at least 60% marks.
- **Management Sciences Program**:
  - HSSC in any discipline with at least 60% overall marks.
  - A-Level with Ds or above grades in two principal subjects.
  - American or Canadian High School Diploma with overall 60% or above marks as per IBCC equivalence formula.

data.title: GIKI Common Admissions Test (GCAT)
data.content: The admission test comprises multiple-choice questions based on Pakistani intermediate-level Physics, Mathematics, and English. For the BS Management Sciences program, the GCAT assesses reading, writing, and mathematical skills. The test is conducted online, and applicants can choose their preferred test center. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

data.title: Steps to Apply
data.content:
1. **Online Application**: Visit the [GIKI Admissions Portal](https://admissions.giki.edu.pk/) to fill out and submit the online application form.
2. **Upload Documents**: Provide a recent color photograph and any other required documents.
3. **Processing Fee**: Pay the application processing fee (Rs. 5,000 for a single test; Rs. 6,000 for both tests; add Rs. 500 if applying for financial assistance) via the provided bank challan.
4. **Admit Card**: Download the admit card from the admissions portal.
5. **Admission Test**: Appear for the admission test at the selected center with the admit card, original Matric/O-Level certificate, and paid bank challan.
6. **Result and Documentation**: Check the test results online and, if offered admission, submit the required documents to the admission office.

data.title: Aid and Scholarships
data.content: GIKI offers financial assistance to deserving students through scholarships and interest-free loans. Applicants can apply for financial aid during the admission process by submitting the financial assistance form along with the admission form and an additional processing fee of Rs. 1,000. Scholarships such as the Punjab Educational Endowment Fund (PEEF) and Chief Minister KP Scholarship are also available, each with specific eligibility criteria. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

data.title: Overview
data.content: The Ghulam Ishaq Khan Institute of Engineering Sciences and Technology (GIKI) is committed to supporting talented and deserving students through various scholarships and financial assistance programs. For the academic year 2024-25, GIKI has allocated over Rs. 200 million to assist undergraduate students, ensuring that financial challenges do not impede access to quality education.

data.title: GIK Merit Scholarship
data.content: This scholarship is awarded to the top 20 candidates based on admission merit. It covers full tuition fees, and top merit applicants are automatically considered without needing a separate application.

data.title: GIKI Financial Assistance
data.content: GIKI provides need-based financial assistance to 40 students on a merit-cum-need basis, which can include full or partial tuition fee coverage. Students must apply through the admissions portal as part of the application process.

data.title: Top Female Students Scholarships
data.content: Ten fully funded scholarships are available for top-performing female applicants based on merit. All top merit female candidates are automatically considered for these scholarships.

data.title: PEEF Scholarship for Punjab Students
data.content: The Punjab Educational Endowment Fund (PEEF) offers scholarships for Punjab-domiciled students with an annual family income of less than Rs. 720,000. Ten partially funded scholarships are provided. Applicants must apply through the admissions portal.

data.title: Chief Minister KP Scholarship
data.content: This scholarship is available to KP-domiciled students, including those from ex-FATA, with an annual family income of less than Rs. 600,000. Twenty fully funded scholarships are offered, and applications should be made via the admissions portal.

data.title: BARD Foundation Scholarship
data.content: A fully funded scholarship available for students eligible for GIKI's financial assistance and hailing from rural areas. This scholarship considers students who have already applied for GIKI's financial aid.

data.title: GIK Alumni Association Scholarships
data.content: Fifty-five fully or partially funded scholarships are offered to students in their second year or beyond based on need. Applications for these scholarships can be made after the first year of study.

data.title: Ihsan Trust Loan
data.content: This program provides twenty need-based, interest-free loans. Applications for these loans can be made after receiving an admission offer from GIKI.

data.title: Sindh Scholarship
data.content: Five fully funded scholarships are available for students domiciled in Sindh, with an annual family income of less than Rs. 1,200,000. Applications for this scholarship can be submitted after joining GIKI.

data.title: CMEEF Scholarship for KP Students
data.content: The Chief Minister Educational Endowment Fund (CMEEF) offers four fully funded scholarships for KP-domiciled students, including ex-FATA residents, with an annual family income of less than Rs. 1,200,000. These scholarships are available specifically for students in the Faculty of Engineering Sciences with a specialization in photonics.

data.title: Balochistan Scholarship (BEEF)
data.content: Four fully funded scholarships are available for students domiciled in Balochistan. Applications for this scholarship can be submitted after joining GIKI.

data.title: Habbah Scholarship Fund
data.content: This scholarship is designed to provide financial relief for students who require additional support to continue their studies at GIKI. Applications and eligibility criteria are outlined in the admissions portal.

data.title: Overview
data.content: The Ghulam Ishaq Khan Institute of Engineering Sciences and Technology (GIKI) offers a structured application process for prospective students aiming to join its esteemed programs. The application process is conducted online, ensuring accessibility and convenience for all applicants. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}

data.title: Application Steps
data.content:
1. **Online Application**: Visit the [GIKI Admissions Portal](https://admissions.giki.edu.pk/) to create an account or log in if you already have one.
2. **Form Submission**: Complete the application form with accurate personal and academic information.
3. **Photograph Upload**: Upload a recent color photograph as per the specified guidelines.
4. **Scholarship Application**: Optionally, apply online for scholarships or financial assistance during the application process.
5. **Processing Fee Payment**:
   - **Print Bank Challan**: Available on the admissions portal.
   - **Fee Details**: Rs. 3,000 for a single test and Rs. 4,500 for both tests; add Rs. 1,000 if applying for financial assistance.
   - **Payment Methods**:
     - **Method 1**: Pay the challan at any Habib Bank Limited (HBL) branch.
     - **Method 2 (Online)**: Use the 1-Bill Top-Up option available through various banks, EasyPaisa, or ATMs.
     - **Method 3**: Use HBL Mobile App or Internet Banking.
   - **Payment Confirmation**: After payment, enter the paid bank challan details into your online profile.
6. **Admit Card**: Download your Admit Card from the admissions portal.
7. **Admission Test**: On the test day, bring the Admit Card, original Matric/O-Level Certificate, and the paid bank challan (GIK copy).
8. **Result and Documentation**: Check your entry test results online through the admissions portal. If offered admission, send the required documents to the admission office as specified.

data.title: Application Steps
data.content:
1. **Online Application**: Access the [GIKI Admissions Portal](https://admissions.giki.edu.pk/) to fill out and submit the online application form.
2. **Document Submission**: Provide attested copies of the following:
   - SSC and HSSC Certificates and Detailed Marks Certificates (DMCs).
   - Bachelor's and Master's Degrees and Transcripts.
   - National Identity Card (CNIC) and Domicile.
3. **Recommendation Letters**: Obtain two letters of recommendation from previous instructors or professionals familiar with your academic performance.
4. **Statement of Purpose**: Write a statement outlining your research interests and career goals.
5. **Research Proposal**: For PhD applicants, include a detailed research proposal.
6. **Processing Fee Payment**:
   - **Fee Details**: Rs. 5,000, payable via a bank challan at any HBL branch.
   - **Payment Confirmation**: After payment, enter the paid bank challan details into your online profile.
7. **Admission Test and Interview**:
   - **Tests Accepted**:
     - ETS GRE (General).
     - HEC-ETC HAT Test.
     - GIKI Admission Test (conducted at GIKI).
   - **Interview**: Shortlisted candidates will be invited for an online interview via Zoom or Skype.

data.title: Processing Fee Payment Options
data.content:
- **Method 1**: Print and pay the challan at any HBL branch.
- **Method 2 (Online)**: Use the 1-Bill Top-Up option available through various banks, EasyPaisa, or ATMs.
   - **Steps**:
     - Select '1 Bill Top-Up'.
     - Enter the Challan No. as the unique bill/invoice/challan/consumer number.
     - Input the total amount.
     - Verify the payment details and confirm the transaction.
- **Method 3**: Using HBL Mobile App or Internet Banking:
   - Open the HBL App or Internet Banking portal.
   - Click on 'Pay' or 'More'.
   - Select 'Education'.
   - Choose 'GIKI New Admission'.
   - Fill in the required details (Admit Card number, Name, Guardian/Father's Name, Amount) and submit.
- **Payment Confirmation**: After payment, enter the paid bank challan details into your online profile.

data.title: Comprehensive Overview
data.content: The Ghulam Ishaq Khan Institute of Engineering Sciences and Technology (GIKI) published its Annual Report for 2023 on May 10, 2024. This report provides an in-depth analysis of the institute's academic achievements, research advancements, and strategic initiatives undertaken throughout the year.

data.title: Educational Excellence
data.content: The report highlights significant academic milestones, including curriculum enhancements, faculty accomplishments, and student successes. It underscores GIKI's commitment to providing quality education and fostering an environment conducive to learning and innovation.

data.title: Innovative Research Initiatives
data.content: GIKI's dedication to research is evident through various projects and collaborations detailed in the report. It showcases advancements in engineering and technology, contributions to scientific knowledge, and partnerships with industry and academic institutions.

data.title: Future-Oriented Projects
data.content: The report outlines strategic initiatives aimed at institutional growth, infrastructure development, and community engagement. These initiatives reflect GIKI's vision to remain at the forefront of engineering education and research.

data.title: Fiscal Responsibility
data.content: An overview of the institute's financial performance is provided, detailing revenue sources, expenditures, and financial planning. This section emphasizes GIKI's commitment to transparency and fiscal responsibility.

data.title: Overview of Application Process
data.content: The Ghulam Ishaq Khan Institute (GIKI) provides a structured process for students applying for both undergraduate and graduate programs. Applicants need to submit their information via the online admissions portal, ensuring accuracy and completeness in their details.

data.title: Application Steps
data.content: Prospective undergraduate students must create an account on the [GIKI Admissions Portal](https://admissions.giki.edu.pk/). The application form should be completed with personal and academic details, and a recent color photograph must be uploaded. A non-refundable processing fee of Rs. 3,000 for a single test or Rs. 4,500 for both tests must be paid at any HBL branch. Additional Rs. 1,000 applies if applying for financial assistance. The admit card for the admission test can be downloaded from the portal.

data.title: Graduate Application Details
data.content: Graduate applicants must submit detailed academic and professional records through the online admissions form, which requires attested copies of all previous degrees and transcripts, a CNIC, and a statement of purpose. PhD applicants must also provide a research proposal. The application fee of Rs. 5,000 is payable at any HBL branch.

data.title: Test and Examination Details
data.content: Undergraduate students must take the GIKI Admission Test, which includes MCQs in Physics, Mathematics, and English. Graduate applicants must pass the GIKI Admission Test, ETS GRE (General), or HEC-ETC HAT Test. Shortlisted graduate candidates will participate in an online interview.

data.title: Fee Payment Methods
data.content: Payments can be made via printed bank challan at HBL branches or through online options like HBL Mobile App or 1-Bill Top-Up from various banking channels. Applicants must enter paid challan details in their profile for verification.

data.title: Supporting Documents
data.content: Applicants need to provide attested copies of academic certificates, CNIC, domicile, and recommendation letters. Graduate applicants must submit a statement of purpose, while PhD candidates must include a research proposal.

data.title: Guidelines and Reminders
data.content: Ensure all submitted information is accurate. Retain copies of documents and payment receipts for records. Regularly check email and the portal for updates.

data.title: Admit Card and Test Day Requirements
data.content: Applicants must download the Admit Card and bring it, along with the original Matric/O-Level Certificate and the paid bank challan (GIKI copy), to the test venue. Graduate applicants must prepare for their interview, conducted via Zoom or Skype.

The institute provides state-of-the-art facilities, diverse student societies, and comprehensive support services to foster personal and professional growth.

data.title: Overview
data.content: The Ghulam Ishaq Khan Institute of Engineering Sciences and Technology (GIKI) mandates that all undergraduate students complete a minimum of 8 weeks of industrial training as part of their degree requirements. This program is designed to enhance students' professional development by providing practical industry experience during their summer break.

data.title: Industry Collaboration
data.content: GIKI collaborates with various companies to offer internship opportunities that are crucial for students' professional growth. Organizations interested in participating in the Summer Internship Program, whether offering paid or unpaid positions, are encouraged to fill out the internship offer form available on the GIKI website.

data.title: How to Apply
data.content: Students seeking internship placements should consult the Career Services Office at GIKI. The office provides guidance on application procedures, resume building, and interview preparation to help students secure suitable internship positions.

data.title: Career Services Office
data.content: For further details regarding internships, students and companies can contact the Career Services Office at GIKI. Contact information is available on the GIKI website under the Careers section.

data.section: Industrial Open House and Careers Fair
data.title: Overview
data.content: The Ghulam Ishaq Khan Institute of Engineering Sciences and Technology (GIKI) annually hosts the Industrial Open House and Careers Fair. This event serves as a platform for graduating students to showcase their Final Year Projects, engage with industry professionals, and explore employment and internship opportunities.

data.title: Bridging Academia and Industry
data.content:
The primary objectives of the Industrial Open House and Careers Fair are:
- **Facilitating Interaction**: Providing a meeting place for senior students and prospective employers.
- **Enhancing Collaboration**: Establishing an effective platform for industry-university interaction.
- **Showcasing Academic Environment**: Offering industry representatives an opportunity to acquaint themselves with the academic environment provided to the students.

data.title: Key Features
data.content:
During the event, industry representatives:
- **Project Evaluations**: Review and assess Final Year Projects presented by graduating students.
- **Recruitment Activities**: Conduct interviews for job placements and internships.
- **Presentations**: Deliver presentations to share industry insights and expectations.
- **Networking**: Engage in one-on-one interactions with the student body to discuss potential collaborations and career opportunities.

data.title: Event Materials
data.content:
In conjunction with the event, GIKI develops several publications, including:
- **Graduate Directory**: A comprehensive list of the graduating batch.
- **Final Year Projects Details**: Information on projects exhibited during the event.
- **Labs and Research Facilities**: An overview of the technical and research facilities available at GIKI.
- **Faculty Profiles**: Detailed profiles of faculty members, highlighting their expertise and research interests.

data.title: Engaging with the Event
data.content: Companies interested in participating or sponsoring the Industrial Open House and Careers Fair can contact the Office of Research, Innovation, and Commercialization (ORIC) at GIKI for more information on registration and sponsorship packages.

data.title: Steps to Obtain Official Transcripts
data.content:
To request official transcripts from Ghulam Ishaq Khan Institute of Engineering Sciences and Technology (GIKI), follow these steps:
1. **Download and Complete the Transcript Request Form**: Obtain the form from the GIKI website, print it, and fill in the required details.
2. **Financial Clearance**:
   - **On-Campus Students**: Obtain clearance from Room No. G09, Finance Department.
   - **Off-Campus Students**: The Admissions & Examinations (A&E) Department will arrange the necessary clearance.
3. **Attach Proof of Payment**: Include proof of payment for the transcript fee with your request form.
4. **Submit the Request**: Send the completed form and payment proof to the Office of Director Admissions & Examinations at GIKI.

data.title: Anticipated Duration for Transcript Processing
data.content: It is advised to submit the transcript request at least three days (72 hours) in advance to ensure timely processing.

data.title: Transcript Fees and Additional Charges
data.content:
- **First Copy**: Rs. 1,200 (US $10 for international requests).
- **Additional Copies**: Rs. 700 (US $8 for international requests) per copy if ordered simultaneously. A maximum of three copies can be provided per order, with the name of the university or organization printed on each.
- **International Courier Delivery**: An additional Rs. 2,300 (US $20) is required for international delivery by courier.

data.title: Accepted Payment Options
data.content:
Attach original proof of payment in any of the following formats:
- **Cash Payment**: Receipt from the account office, Room No. G12, Administration Block.
- **Online Payment in Pakistan Rupees**: Transfer to HBL A/C No. 19790000085901.
- **Swift Transfer of US Dollars**: Transfer to HBL A/C No. 19790002044611, SWIFT Code HABB PKK AXXX.
- **Bank Draft**: Draft in favor of G.I.K. Institute, drawable at HBL GIK Branch.

data.title: Guidelines for Transcript Delivery
data.content:
- **Domestic Delivery**: Transcripts are sent within Pakistan through registered mail at no extra charge.
- **International Delivery**: For overseas delivery via courier, an additional payment of Rs. 2,300 (US $20) is required.
- **Envelope Specifications**: Clearly mention the name of the graduate school and the total number of transcripts per envelope (e.g., '2' for two transcripts in one envelope, '1+1' for two transcripts in separate envelopes). Provide the complete address of the recipient institution or organization.

data.title: Office of Director Admissions & Examinations
data.content:
For further assistance, contact:

data.title: Location and Contact
data.content: GIKI is located near Tarbela Dam in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, approximately a 1.5-hour drive from Islamabad. For general inquiries, contact the Admissions Office at ugadmissions@giki.edu.pk or +92 (0)938 281026.

data.title: Correcting Application Details
data.content: To correct your application details, log into your profile on the GIK Admission Portal and use the 'Contact Us' option. You can also email the corrections to ugadmissions@giki.edu.pk with relevant details.

data.title: Entry Test and Format
data.content: The GIKI entry test is required for all applicants, covering intermediate-level Physics, Mathematics, and English. Applicants should review the syllabus and pattern available on the GIKI website under the admissions section.

data.title: Minimum Requirements
data.content: Applicants need to have passed HSSC or equivalent with at least 60% in relevant subjects for engineering disciplines. International qualifications should be certified by the IBCC.

data.title: Advanced Standing for Transfer Students
data.content: Students enrolled in relevant programs at other accredited universities can apply for transfer with a minimum of 15 transferable credits and a CGPA of 2.5/4.0. Admission is subject to available seats and passing the GIKI entry test or equivalent SAT-II score.

data.title: Scholarships and Aid
data.content: GIKI offers various financial aid and scholarships based on merit and need. Students are encouraged to apply for aid through the admissions portal. Specific details can be found in the financial assistance section of the GIKI website.
